options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI assistant designed to process incoming email messages and prepare appropriate responses. For each email message you receive, follow these steps:

Check for Existing Labels:

Use the "Get Email Labels" tool to determine if the email already has an associated label.
If a label exists, proceed directly to Step 3.
If no label exists, proceed to Step 2.
Create and Assign a New Label:

Use the "Create Label" tool to create a new label relevant to the email's content. The label name should reflect the subject or key theme of the email.
Use the "Add Label to Message" tool to assign the newly created label to the email message.
Draft Affirmative and Negative Responses:

Use the "Draft Email" tool to compose two versions of a response to the email:
An affirmative response that accepts or agrees with the email's request or content.
A negative response that politely declines or disagrees with the email's request or content.
Ensure both responses are professional, clear, and appropriate for the context.
Available Tools:

Get Email Labels: Retrieve labels associated with an email.
Create Label: Create a new label.
Add Label to Message: Assign a label to an email message.
Draft Email: Compose a draft email response.
Guidelines:

Always ensure that labels are meaningful and accurately represent the email's content.
When drafting responses, maintain a professional tone and address the sender appropriately.
Use the tools efficiently to complete the tasks in order.

json.html:
Hi Ron,

I hope this message finds you well.

Please find attached the Proposal document with rough/ballpark estimates.

Additionally, kindly check the attached Word document and refer to the section dated "Systenics 5-Nov-2024" to read our 6 comments.

702Auctions - Phase 1 Requirements and Discussions.docx

I have checked the available meeting times, and unfortunately, they are either too early or too late for me. Therefore, I suggest we continue our communication via email to discuss the cost estimates and your budget. We can use the Word document for discussions regarding the requirements.

Typically, we provide a rough/ballpark estimate to help with budget planning. Once you approve the estimates and confirm that you are ready to work with us, we will raise an advance payment invoice for the requirement and task detailing (activity #1). We will then spend more time on task detailing and revise the estimates if necessary. After you approve the task detailing, we will raise an advance payment invoice for the approved tasks and commence development.

Please let me know your thoughts on this approach and if you would like us to proceed with your project customizations.

---

From: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 11:36 AM
To: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Cc: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>; automatestpete@gmail.com <automatestpete@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: AuctionWorx customization
 
Hi Ron,

Thank you for your reply and for sharing the customization requests.

As our office has re-opened today after the Diwali festival holidays and most of our team is still enjoying their remaining annual leaves, it will take us some time to review your requirements and get back to you. We aim to provide some feedback over the weekend.

Additionally, I will check my schedule to see if I can be available for a meeting during your morning or evening time.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.

---
 
From: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 4:09 AM
To: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com>
Cc: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>; automatestpete@gmail.com <automatestpete@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: AuctionWorx customization
 
Hi Shailesh

I apologize for the delay. I'm still interested. I checked your available times and unfortunately my schedule conflicts with your available hours. I'm available 8AM-6:30PM Pacific standard time. That being said, we can do this through email. I don't necessarily need a meeting unless it's 100% necessary.

this is what i'm looking to do:
  1. I want to set up and transfer my existing auctionflex site to another hosting platform so I can have access to the backend and database for future development. We have a few hosting options that we have researched but we are open to any alternatives you may suggest.
  2. I want to modify the existing custom sms functionality to send out messages to customers 2 minutes before an item closes when they are losing or watching (not winning) the item.  We already have existing Twilio integration, but it's designed to send the message to all participating bidders and watchers 10 minutes before the auction ends (sends to all at once). Also, I currently have no control over the endpoints. 
  3. For the new sms, I don't need the integration with twilio to be updated. I just want the functionality to be added and fields added in the Site Preferences for the webhook endpoints and on/off toggles. Adding one for each of the existing notices (Outbid, invoice is ready, auction ending, and the new item ending that I need created) and I'll set up the actual messaging myself. I'll attach a screenshot of the current site preferences that were added in the previous customization.
  4. I would like a quote for the mobile app Buyers + Sellers Edition. It says $2299 on your site but are there additional charges? Also, is there a discount for doing this at the same time?
  5. I would like a quote for adding the ability to create a return. Ideally, I would like to send an api call or webhook with the invoice number and lot number, have the item marked returned, and send a call to stripe refunding the amount that was returned. Currently, to return an item, I have to mark the invoice unpaid, remove the item, mark paid, look up the item in sales report, void the item, and refund through stripe.
Let me know if we can just move forward with a price and scope, or if you would like to set something up to discuss. 

Thanks
Ron Williams
702 Auctions

On Thu, Oct 17, 2024 at 12:26 AM Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com> wrote:
Hi Ron,

I hope you are doing well.

I wanted to follow up and see if you had a chance to go through Saurabh's email dated 11th October 2024. Within the email, there is a link provided to book a meeting. If you encounter any issues with this link, please let me know.

Additionally, I can send you a Microsoft Teams meeting invitation. For that, kindly share your time zone and your available time slots, and I will find out if it matches our business hours and schedule a meeting.

Looking forward to your response.

---

From: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>
Sent: Friday, October 11, 2024 10:46 PM
To: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Cc: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com>
Subject: RE: AuctionWorx customization
 

Hi Ron,

 

Thank you for contacting us again. I am connecting you with my colleague Shailesh Patel who looks after AuctionWorx customizations.

 

It will be helpful if you can use the following link to book an appointment for a meeting with Shailesh discuss your requirements. We can do both hosting as well as customization.

https://outlook.office365.com/owa/calendar/sales1@systenics.net/bookings/

 

As a RainWorx Premium Partner with over 10 years of experience customizing AuctionWorx, Systenics offers a suite of products and services designed to maximize engagement, save you time, and cut costs. [https://www.systenics.com/auctionworx/]

 

Here's how we can help:

  • Increase Customer Participation:
    • AuctionWorx Mobile App: Engage users on-the-go with bidding, push notifications, and seller tools (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/AuctionWorx-Mobile-Apps]).
    • Live Auctions: Host captivating online and offline auctions simultaneously, reaching a wider audience with our low-latency video solution (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/live-auctions]).
  • Boost Efficiency and Save Time:
    • Excel Plugin: Effortlessly manage large numbers of listings. Skip the tedious CSV import and create/edit thousands of entries directly in Excel, including image uploads (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/auctionworx-listings-creation-excel-plugin]). Save your team 30-40% of listing management time!
    • AI Description Generator: Generate professional, unique descriptions for your listings in seconds using AI – no more manual work required (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/ai-enhanced-listings-description-generation]).
    • AI Co-Pilot for AuctionWorx: Reduce customer support workload. Our AI assistant answers FAQs and complex questions, freeing up your team (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/products/]).

We look forward to connecting!

 

 

Regards,

Saurabh Nandu

CEO

Systenics Solutions

+91-9930600900

 

From: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Sent: 11 October 2024 21:55
To: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>
Subject: AuctionWorx customization

 

You don't often get email from ron@702auctions.com. Learn why this is important

Hello. Im looking for a quote for some customization to my auctionworx site. I believe you have done some customization for us in the past. 

this is what I'm looking to do:

 

  • Move the server hosting to a different provider so I can have more control and access to the backend and database. 
  • I have added twilio sms messaging for an auction ending alert already. I want to expand this to include sms alerts for watched or outbid items ending in 2 minutes, as well as the ability for a customer to turn the individual alerts off and on. (There is a single enable messaging selector currently)

I would like to update to the current version when transferring the hosting also. The site is bid.702auctions.com

json.text:
Hi Ron,

I hope this message finds you well.

Please find attached the Proposal document with rough/ballpark estimates.

Additionally, kindly check the attached Word document and refer to the section dated "Systenics 5-Nov-2024" to read our 6 comments.

[https://res.cdn.office.net/assets/mail/file-icon/png/docx_16x16.png]702Auctions - Phase 1 Requirements and Discussions.docx<https://systenicssol-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/shailesh_systenics_com/EUYK9Tt3pj9PqF53uk32a8cBix0TPOCt-omKf0VBIQA4Og?e=coKXNd>

I have checked the available meeting times, and unfortunately, they are either too early or too late for me. Therefore, I suggest we continue our communication via email to discuss the cost estimates and your budget. We can use the Word document for discussions regarding the requirements.

Typically, we provide a rough/ballpark estimate to help with budget planning. Once you approve the estimates and confirm that you are ready to work with us, we will raise an advance payment invoice for the requirement and task detailing (activity #1). We will then spend more time on task detailing and revise the estimates if necessary. After you approve the task detailing, we will raise an advance payment invoice for the approved tasks and commence development.

Please let me know your thoughts on this approach and if you would like us to proceed with your project customizations.

---

________________________________
From: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 11:36 AM
To: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Cc: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>; automatestpete@gmail.com <automatestpete@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: AuctionWorx customization

Hi Ron,

Thank you for your reply and for sharing the customization requests.

As our office has re-opened today after the Diwali festival holidays and most of our team is still enjoying their remaining annual leaves, it will take us some time to review your requirements and get back to you. We aim to provide some feedback over the weekend.

Additionally, I will check my schedule to see if I can be available for a meeting during your morning or evening time.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.

---

________________________________
From: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 4:09 AM
To: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com>
Cc: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>; automatestpete@gmail.com <automatestpete@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: AuctionWorx customization

Hi Shailesh

I apologize for the delay. I'm still interested. I checked your available times and unfortunately my schedule conflicts with your available hours. I'm available 8AM-6:30PM Pacific standard time. That being said, we can do this through email. I don't necessarily need a meeting unless it's 100% necessary.

this is what i'm looking to do:

  1.  I want to set up and transfer my existing auctionflex site to another hosting platform so I can have access to the backend and database for future development. We have a few hosting options that we have researched but we are open to any alternatives you may suggest.
  2.  I want to modify the existing custom sms functionality to send out messages to customers 2 minutes before an item closes when they are losing or watching (not winning) the item.  We already have existing Twilio integration, but it's designed to send the message to all participating bidders and watchers 10 minutes before the auction ends (sends to all at once). Also, I currently have no control over the endpoints.
  3.  For the new sms, I don't need the integration with twilio to be updated. I just want the functionality to be added and fields added in the Site Preferences for the webhook endpoints and on/off toggles. Adding one for each of the existing notices (Outbid, invoice is ready, auction ending, and the new item ending that I need created) and I'll set up the actual messaging myself. I'll attach a screenshot of the current site preferences that were added in the previous customization.
  4.  I would like a quote for the mobile app Buyers + Sellers Edition. It says $2299 on your site but are there additional charges? Also, is there a discount for doing this at the same time?
  5.  I would like a quote for adding the ability to create a return. Ideally, I would like to send an api call or webhook with the invoice number and lot number, have the item marked returned, and send a call to stripe refunding the amount that was returned. Currently, to return an item, I have to mark the invoice unpaid, remove the item, mark paid, look up the item in sales report, void the item, and refund through stripe.

Let me know if we can just move forward with a price and scope, or if you would like to set something up to discuss.

Thanks
Ron Williams
702 Auctions

json.textAsHtml:
Hi Ron,

I hope this message finds you well.

Please find attached the Proposal document with rough/ballpark estimates.

Additionally, kindly check the attached Word document and refer to the section dated "Systenics 5-Nov-2024" to read our 6 comments.

[https://res.cdn.office.net/assets/mail/file-icon/png/docx_16x16.png]702Auctions - Phase 1 Requirements and Discussions.docx<https://systenicssol-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/shailesh_systenics_com/EUYK9Tt3pj9PqF53uk32a8cBix0TPOCt-omKf0VBIQA4Og?e=coKXNd>

I have checked the available meeting times, and unfortunately, they are either too early or too late for me. Therefore, I suggest we continue our communication via email to discuss the cost estimates and your budget. We can use the Word document for discussions regarding the requirements.

Typically, we provide a rough/ballpark estimate to help with budget planning. Once you approve the estimates and confirm that you are ready to work with us, we will raise an advance payment invoice for the requirement and task detailing (activity #1). We will then spend more time on task detailing and revise the estimates if necessary. After you approve the task detailing, we will raise an advance payment invoice for the approved tasks and commence development.

Please let me know your thoughts on this approach and if you would like us to proceed with your project customizations.

---

________________________________
From: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 11:36 AM
To: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Cc: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>; automatestpete@gmail.com <automatestpete@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: AuctionWorx customization

Hi Ron,

Thank you for your reply and for sharing the customization requests.

As our office has re-opened today after the Diwali festival holidays and most of our team is still enjoying their remaining annual leaves, it will take us some time to review your requirements and get back to you. We aim to provide some feedback over the weekend.

Additionally, I will check my schedule to see if I can be available for a meeting during your morning or evening time.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.

---

________________________________
From: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 4:09 AM
To: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com>
Cc: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com>; automatestpete@gmail.com <automatestpete@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: AuctionWorx customization

Hi Shailesh

I apologize for the delay. I'm still interested. I checked your available times and unfortunately my schedule conflicts with your available hours. I'm available 8AM-6:30PM Pacific standard time. That being said, we can do this through email. I don't necessarily need a meeting unless it's 100% necessary.

this is what i'm looking to do:

1. I want to set up and transfer my existing auctionflex site to another hosting platform so I can have access to the backend and database for future development. We have a few hosting options that we have researched but we are open to any alternatives you may suggest.
2. I want to modify the existing custom sms functionality to send out messages to customers 2 minutes before an item closes when they are losing or watching (not winning) the item. We already have existing Twilio integration, but it's designed to send the message to all participating bidders and watchers 10 minutes before the auction ends (sends to all at once). Also, I currently have no control over the endpoints.
3. For the new sms, I don't need the integration with twilio to be updated. I just want the functionality to be added and fields added in the Site Preferences for the webhook endpoints and on/off toggles. Adding one for each of the existing notices (Outbid, invoice is ready, auction ending, and the new item ending that I need created) and I'll set up the actual messaging myself. I'll attach a screenshot of the current site preferences that were added in the previous customization.
4. I would like a quote for the mobile app Buyers + Sellers Edition. It says $2299 on your site but are there additional charges? Also, is there a discount for doing this at the same time?
5. I would like a quote for adding the ability to create a return. Ideally, I would like to send an api call or webhook with the invoice number and lot number, have the item marked returned, and send a call to stripe refunding the amount that was returned. Currently, to return an item, I have to mark the invoice unpaid, remove the item, mark paid, look up the item in sales report, void the item, and refund through stripe.

Let me know if we can just move forward with a price and scope, or if you would like to set something up to discuss.

Thanks
Ron Williams
702 Auctions

On Thu, Oct 17, 2024 at 12:26 AM Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com<mailto:shailesh@systenics.com>> wrote:
Hi Ron,

I hope you are doing well.

I wanted to follow up and see if you had a chance to go through Saurabh's email dated 11th October 2024. Within the email, there is a link provided to book a meeting. If you encounter any issues with this link, please let me know.

Additionally, I can send you a Microsoft Teams meeting invitation. For that, kindly share your time zone and your available time slots, and I will find out if it matches our business hours and schedule a meeting.

Looking forward to your response.

---

________________________________
From: Saurabh Nandu <info@systenics.com<mailto:info@systenics.com>>
Sent: Friday, October 11, 2024 10:46 PM
To: Ron Williams <ron@702auctions.com<mailto:ron@702auctions.com>>
Cc: Shailesh Patel <shailesh@systenics.com<mailto:shailesh@systenics.com>>
Subject: RE: AuctionWorx customization

Hi Ron,

Thank you for contacting us again. I am connecting you with my colleague Shailesh Patel who looks after AuctionWorx customizations.

It will be helpful if you can use the following link to book an appointment for a meeting with Shailesh discuss your requirements. We can do both hosting as well as customization.

https://outlook.office365.com/owa/calendar/sales1@systenics.net/bookings/

As a RainWorx Premium Partner with over 10 years of experience customizing AuctionWorx, Systenics offers a suite of products and services designed to maximize engagement, save you time, and cut costs. [https://www.systenics.com/auctionworx/]

Here's how we can help:

* Increase Customer Participation:
* AuctionWorx Mobile App: Engage users on-the-go with bidding, push notifications, and seller tools (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/AuctionWorx-Mobile-Apps]).
* Live Auctions: Host captivating online and offline auctions simultaneously, reaching a wider audience with our low-latency video solution (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/live-auctions]).
* Boost Efficiency and Save Time:
* Excel Plugin: Effortlessly manage large numbers of listings. Skip the tedious CSV import and create/edit thousands of entries directly in Excel, including image uploads (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/auctionworx-listings-creation-excel-plugin]). Save your team 30-40% of listing management time!
* AI Description Generator: Generate professional, unique descriptions for your listings in seconds using AI – no more manual work required (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/ai-enhanced-listings-description-generation]).
* AI Co-Pilot for AuctionWorx: Reduce customer support workload. Our AI assistant answers FAQs and complex questions, freeing up your team (details here: [https://www.systenics.com/products/]).

We look forward to connecting!

Regards,

Saurabh Nandu

CEO

Systenics Solutions
